page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Wisbech St.Mary is a small Fenland village,situated 4miles south-west of Wisbech with a population of 1,000.A landscape characterised by wide views and an open skyscape surronds this quiet rural village.The absence of hills results in glorious sunsets that cast fascinating and vivid colours.The village is surrounded by a grid of well maintained drainage channels,part of our heritage. The village shows a changing face every month as the agriculture is varied and intensive.Smallholders work their land throughout the hours of daylight.The crops need constant attention,they can however easily fail through a bad market or freak weather conditions eg.The Fen Blow.As a means ofinsurance smallholders diversify. This survey hopefully captures a little of the special atmosphere here.
